item.title: 暴风雨 "弗洛里斯 "将导致英国旅行中断 风灾警告升级
item.description: 由于大风天气警报已经升级，暴风雪弗洛里斯可能会在周一造成严重的出行中断。【原文：Storm Floris could cause severe travel disruption on Monday as weather warnings for wind have been upgraded.】

item.title: 免费空调计划在危及生命的酷暑中提供帮助
item.description:
随着地球升温，各州和地方慈善机构正在帮助减少低收入家庭的降温缺口。【原文：

States and local charities are helping reduce the cooling gap for low-income households as the planet heats up.

】

item.title: 美国税收法案出台后，埃克森可能放缓氢能和低碳项目的实施
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）警告说，由于国会削减了作为唐纳德-特朗普总统税收和支出一揽子计划一部分的激励措施，其在得克萨斯州建造世界上最大的低碳氢气工厂的项目可能会面临延期。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. warned its project to build the world’s biggest low-carbon hydrogen plant in Texas could face delays after Congress curtailed incentives as part of President Donald Trump’s tax and spending package.】

item.title: 英国交易商 Javelin 收购美国发电厂股份获批
item.description: 根据 7 月份提交的一份文件，交易商 Javelin Global Commodities 参股俄亥俄州一家燃煤电厂的交易获得了美国联邦能源管理委员会的批准。【原文：A deal that gives trading house Javelin Global Commodities a stake in an Ohio coal fired power plant received approval from the US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, according to a July filing.】

item.title: 南非正在考虑为大城市提供洪水保险
item.description: 近年来，南非发生了一系列灾难，导致政府不得不提供救助，因此南非正在研究一些最大的城市是否应该购买洪水保险。【原文：South Africa is studying whether some of its largest cities should take out flood insurance after a series of disasters in recent years led to bailouts from the government.】

item.title: 野火烟雾笼罩芝加哥，Lollapalooza 音乐节正在举行
item.description: 加拿大野火产生的浓烟笼罩了美国中西部地区，导致芝加哥大型音乐节期间的空气质量下降。【原文：A thick haze of smoke from Canadian wildfires has descended on the US Midwest, degrading air quality during a major music festival in Chicago.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行退出被华尔街和汇丰银行抛弃的零净值俱乐部
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）刚刚成为继华尔街同业和汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）之后，最新一家退出全球最大气候联盟的大型银行。【原文：Barclays Plc just became the latest major bank to walk out of the world’s biggest climate group for the industry, following its Wall Street peers and HSBC Holdings Plc out of the coalition.】

item.title: 法国将为可再生能源提供创纪录的 90 亿欧元补贴
item.description: 据监管机构称，法国政府对可再生能源的补贴将在 2025 年几乎翻番后，于明年猛增 23%，达到创纪录的 90 亿欧元（103 亿美元）。【原文：French government subsidies for renewable energy are set to jump 23% to a record €9 billion ($10.3 billion) next year, after almost doubling in 2025, according to the regulator.】

item.title: 从天气预报到沙丁鱼，人工智能正在快速推动气候研究
item.description:
科学家们认为这项技术的应用将在多个领域 "向前迈出一大步"。【原文：

Scientists see using the technology as a “gigantic step forward” in a variety of fields.

】

item.title: 欧洲为八月凉爽开局后的下一波热浪做好准备
item.description: 欧洲的下一波热浪已经在伊比利亚半岛上空形成，有可能在 8 月份不寻常的凉爽开端之后考验更多的气温记录。【原文：Europe’s next heat wave is already building over the Iberian peninsula, potentially testing more temperature records after an unseasonably cool start to August.】

item.title: 价值 25 亿美元的电缆将帮助澳大利亚开发塔斯马尼亚州的水坝
item.description: 澳大利亚已批准在本土和可再生能源丰富的岛国塔斯马尼亚之间建造一条价值数十亿美元的海底电力电缆。【原文：Australia has cleared the construction of a multibillion-dollar undersea power cable between the mainland and renewables-rich island state Tasmania.】

item.title: 热浪、暴雨肆虐，纽约地铁再遭浩劫
item.description: 在极端天气的影响下，纽约市大都会交通局的工作正陷入困境，暴雨和酷热引发了重大的服务中断，乘客们争先恐后地寻找替代方案。【原文：New York City’s Metropolitan Transportation Authority is buckling under the strain of extreme weather, with torrential rain and sweltering heat triggering major service disruptions and sending riders scrambling for alternatives.】

item.title: 多云无风天气威胁欧洲能源安全
item.description: 据伍德麦肯兹有限公司（Wood Mackenzie Ltd.）称，欧洲的能源安全正受到风能和太阳能产量长期低迷的威胁，这也是市场剧烈波动的原因之一。【原文：Europe’s energy security is being threatened by prolonged periods of low wind and solar output, something that’s also driving extreme market volatility, according to Wood Mackenzie Ltd.】

item.title: PG&E 因 Newsom 计划投资者向消防基金付款而下跌
item.description: PG&E Corp. 的股价因加州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）的一项提案而下跌，该提案要求该公用事业公司的股东为补充加州野火保险基金做出重大贡献。【原文：PG&E Corp. shares fell on a proposal by California Governor Gavin Newsom that would require the utility company’s shareholders to make a significant contribution to the replenishment of California’s wildfire insurance fund.】

item.title: 特朗普支持的科学家如何试图破坏气候共识
item.description:
能源部委托编写的一份新报告淡化了全球变暖的问题，因为政府正试图放松环境规则。【原文：

A new report commissioned by the Energy Department downplays global warming as the administration seeks to unwind environmental rules. 

】

item.title: 纽约市面临暴雨引发急流洪水的威胁
item.description: 据预测，周四纽约市将迎来一轮暴雨和雷暴天气，有可能造成交通延误和道路积水，而此时正是工人们离开办公室回家通勤的时间。【原文：A round of heavy rain and thunderstorms is forecast to descend on New York City on Thursday, threatening to unleash transit delays and inundate roads just as workers leave their offices for the home-bound commute.】

item.title: 城市追随风的脚步，寻求从高温和雾霾中解脱
item.description:
几十年前，德国城市斯图加特研究了当地的空气流动模式，以指导战后重建。现在，亚洲的特大城市正在借鉴这一经验来应对雾霾。【原文：

Decades ago, the German city of Stuttgart studied local air flow patterns to guide its postwar rebuilding. Now Asia’s megacities are taking lessons to combat smog. 

】

item.title: 苏格兰批准建设世界上最大的海上风电场
item.description: 苏格兰政府已同意 SSE Plc 建造世界上最大的海上风电场。【原文：The Scottish government has given SSE Plc consent to build what would be the world’s biggest offshore wind farm.】

item.title: 斯坦查特首席执行官称银行退出净零计划 "令其蒙羞
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）首席执行官比尔-温特斯（Bill Winters）对那些最近放弃实现净零排放承诺的银行说了几句强硬的话。【原文：The chief executive officer of Standard Chartered Plc, Bill Winters, has some strong words for banks that have recently walked back their commitment to achieving net zero emissions.】

item.title: 太平洋岛国如何对抗大型污染企业并取得胜利
item.description:
ClientEarth首席执行官劳拉-克拉克（Laura Clarke）说，国际法院重塑了未来几十年的气候诉讼。【原文：

Laura Clarke, chief executive officer of ClientEarth, say the International Court of Justice has reshaped climate litigation for decades to come. 

】

item.title: 卢森堡调查中国二氧化碳排放额度中可能存在的不当行为
item.description: 卢森堡当局正在调查可能与设在中国的碳信用额项目有关的不法行为，欧洲公司利用这些项目减少二氧化碳足迹。【原文：Luxembourg authorities are looking into possible wrongdoing tied to carbon-credit projects based in China that have been tapped by European companies to reduce their CO2 footprints.】

item.title: 泰国首富认为 100 亿美元的水电和液化天然气项目将推动增长
item.description: 泰国首富萨拉特-拉塔纳瓦迪（Sarath Ratanavadi）预计，在邻国老挝的水电项目和一个新的国内液化天然气终端的 100 亿美元投资将推动其商业帝国的增长。【原文：Thailand’s richest person, Sarath Ratanavadi, expects $10 billion investments in hydropower projects in neighboring Laos and a new domestic liquefied natural gas terminal to drive his business empire’s growth.】

item.title: 世界离可再生能源翻两番的里程碑目标还很遥远
item.description:
一份新报告发现，国家绿色能源目标不足以实现2030年的全球承诺。【原文：

A new report finds national green energy targets aren’t enough to meet a global pledge for 2030.

】

item.title: 纽瑟姆寻求为公用事业野火基金拨款 180 亿美元，加州未来将面临大火袭击
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）正在散发一份立法提案，以支持在 1 月份洛杉矶县发生致命野火后面临枯竭风险的州公用事业基金。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom is circulating a legislative proposal to shore up a state fund for utilities that’s at risk of being depleted following the deadly wildfires that struck Los Angeles County in January.】

item.title: 特朗普取消数百万英亩指定用于风力发电的海域
item.description: 在对可再生能源的攻击不断升级之际，特朗普政府正在撤销对数百万英亩海域用于海上风电开发的批准。【原文：The Trump administration is revoking approval for millions of acres of ocean to be set aside for offshore wind development amid an escalating attack on the renewable power source.】

item.title: 塞缪尔-杰克逊在受到特朗普批评后加入风党竞选活动
item.description: 演员塞缪尔-杰克逊（Samuel L. Jackson）加入了瑞典能源公司 Vattenfall AB 推广海上风力发电场的活动，这标志着这位 "纸浆小说 "明星与美国总统之间的最新分歧。【原文：Actor Samuel L. Jackson joined a campaign by Swedish energy company Vattenfall AB to promote offshore wind farms, marking the latest area of disagreement between the Pulp Fiction star and the US President.】

item.title: 美国和印度航天局发射地球观测卫星
item.description: 美国和印度发射了一颗共同开发的卫星，该卫星将提供数据以支持自然灾害应对工作，这一任务凸显了印度为扩大国际伙伴关系并成为全球太空领导者所做的努力。【原文：The US and India launched a co-developed satellite that will deliver data to support natural disaster response efforts, a mission underscoring India’s efforts to broaden its international partnerships and become a global space leader.】

item.title: 南非国家保险公司为暴乱建立 11 亿美元缓冲区
item.description: 南非的国有风险保险公司在政府的救助下，得以应对四年前暴乱引发的索赔，该公司已建立了 200 亿兰特（11 亿美元）的缓冲资金，以保障在未来发生预期动乱时的财务安全。【原文：South Africa’s state-owned risk insurer, which the government bailed out so it could meet claims stemming from riots four years ago, has built up a 20 billion-rand ($1.1 billion) buffer to safeguard its finances in the event of anticipated future unrest.】

item.title: 锂矿商敲响警钟，电动汽车困境带来压力
item.description: 本周，澳大利亚锂生产商发布的一系列公司报告让人们重新关注这个因减记、成本控制和艰难抉择而备受摧残的行业，因为全球电动汽车转型正遭遇逆风。【原文：A slew of corporate reports from Australian lithium producers has thrown a fresh spotlight this week on an industry riven by write-downs, cost controls and hard choices as the world’s electric-vehicle transition runs into headwinds.】

item.title: 法律风险加速各国的气候适应计划
item.description: 在将全球升温限制在 1.5°C 的努力中失败的国家面临着越来越大的法律风险，这可能会促使它们加快适应气候的努力。【原文：Countries that fall short in efforts to limit global warming to 1.5°C face growing legal risks that could push them to accelerate climate adaptation efforts.】
